column4: Does someone know how to make Shift-PageUp/Down work in ttys like they do in terminals (e.g. scrolling)?
it usually does as far as i remember?
in a xterm/gnome-terminal it does, not in a real tty
e.g. in /dev/tty1
they are supposed to
works for me on an unmodified 10.10 server
hmm... odd did you install any special package?
fresh install with nothing installed at all
on my laptop, the PgUp and PgDown are on the same position as the 9 and 3 on the numeric keypad. Could that be related?
are you using screen?
no screen
it could
it is probably sending numpad pageup instead of the other pageup
odd it works in FF/man/less, but not in terminals (even pseudo ones)
less is just picking it up as a regular page up, with no shift
so PgUp is recognized but not Shift + PgUp?
Anyway to verify that?

less has a binding for its own scrolling using page up and page down, as well as arrow keys etc, shift-pageup if it was working, wouldn't be handled by less, it is handled at tty level, not at software level
you can probably play around with loadkeys and kernel keymaps to make it work, i'll have a quick look
are you still there?
yes
